thread.title: VOTE: Grade Cowboys' top 10 offseason moves; how have new acquisitions performed so far?
thread.title_full: VOTE: Grade Cowboys' top 10 offseason moves; how have new acquisitions performed so far? | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: VOTE: Grade Cowboys' top 10 offseason moves; how have new acquisitions performed so far?
text:
The Dallas Cowboys, currently sitting at 2-3, have needed all kinds of new faces to produce with Tony Romo and Dez Bryant sidelined with injuries.
Before the season started, insider Jon Machota ranked the team's top 10 offseason moves . It's time to grade those moves.
Below are each of his 10 acquisitions, as well as polls to vote in.
10. Signing free agent linebacker Andrew Gachkar to a two-year deal in March Machota: "The former Charger has steadily moved up the depth chart to where he's been receiving first-team reps. The valuable special teams contributor is expected to help out at MIKE and SAM linebacker spots. With Anthony Hitchens nursing a foot injury and Rolando McClain suspended the first four games, Gachkar could prove to be very valuable in the middle."
How would you grade Andrew Gachkar's performance so far?
9. Re-signing Rolando McClain Machota: "Keeping McClain for another year could prove to be beneficial down the stretch. When McClain was playing well last season, the Dallas defense was clearly at its best. That leaves many to wonder: what could that group look like with McClain lining up alongside a healthy Sean Lee and defensive upgrades like Greg Hardy, Byron Jones and Randy Gregory?"
How would you grade Rolando McClain's performance so far?
8. Signing Cole Beasley to a contract extension Machota: "A new four-year deal for Beasley is a move that should greatly benefit Tony Romo. The receiver Jason Garrett often says is "quarterback friendly" played some of his best ball down the stretch last season. During the Cowboys' final six games, they went 5-1 as Beasley totaled 277 yards and four touchdowns. In the two playoff games, he caught seven passes for 101 yards."
How would you grade Cole Beasley's performance so far?
7.) Signing Darren McFadden Machota: "With DeMarco Murray joining the rival Eagles, the Cowboys needed another back. They went with this former top five pick who only had one 1,000-yard season in seven years with the Raiders. McFadden will likely split carries with Joseph Randle. Could the Cowboys' talented offensive line pave the way for McFadden' best pro season? It's a possibility if he stays healthy. He showed glimpses of his potential during the third preseason game against Minnesota."
How would you grade Darren McFadden's performance so far?
6. Signing Greg Hardy Machota: "It was obviously a highly controversial move. Hardy's off-the-field issues led to a 10-game suspension from the league. That has since been reduced to four games. Hardy could still fight to get that total reduced further. Either way, when the 2013 Pro Bowler gets on the field, he will instantly upgrade Rod Marinelli's group of rushmen."
How would you grade Greg Hardy's performance so far?
5. Acquiring a third first-round talent Machota: "As if drafting Byron Jones and Randy Gregory weren't enough, the Cowboys landed another elite college talent when they signed La'el Collins following the draft. The former LSU standout left tackle went undrafted after he was part of a murder investigation. He was never considered a person of interest or a suspect by police. Collins, who was free to sign with any team, chose the Cowboys after Jerry Jones rolled out the red carpet during a recruiting visit at Jones' home. Jason Garrett, Tony Romo, Jason Witten and several Cowboys offensive linemen were all in attendance. Collins showed glimpses during the preseason of why many considered him a first-round pick."
How would you grade La'el Collins' performance so far?
4. Having a strong draft Machota: "Even though a draft class can't accurately be graded after only a few months, the Cowboys turned heads by landing what some would consider two first-round picks. A defensive back like Byron Jones and a pass-rusher like Randy Gregory have star potential. They are both expected to immediately contribute. Many teams wanted no part of Gregory because of off-the-field concerns, which allowed him to fall into the second round. The pick was a risk, but the payoff could be huge. In Dallas, Gregory won't be asked to start right away. He can learn from one of the game's best defensive gurus while gradually adding weight to become an every down player."
How would you grade the performance of Byron Jones, Randy Gregory and other 2015 draftees?
3. Locking up their offensive and defensive coordinators Machota: "The Cowboys arguably had the best combination of coordinators in the NFL last season. Rod Marinelli is as good as they come when you're talking about defensive football. The same can be said about Scott Linehan when talking offense. To build off last season's success, it was critical to keep the continuity throughout the coaching staff. Both signed three-year deals."
How would you grade Scott Linehan and Rod Marinelli's performance so far?
2. Giving Jason Garrett a contract extension Machota: "Many would say that the head coach is the most important piece of a football team. The Cowboys believe they have found the right one in Garrett. Over the previous four and a half seasons, the former NFL quarterback has led the Cowboys to a 41-31 record, including a 12-4 mark last season. He was rewarded with a five-year extension in January."
How would you grade Jason Garrett's performance so far?
1. Signing Dez Bryant to a long-term contract Machota: "Outside of Tony Romo, Bryant is the Cowboys' most valuable player. His ability on the field changes the way defenses gameplan for the Cowboys. Even though he was under the franchise tag, Bryant made it clear that he was willing to skip training camp and games if a long-term deal wasn't reached by the July 15 deadline. Jerry Jones and Stephen Jones flew to New York to get a deal done with Bryant's representatives in the final hour. Now, the Cowboys head into the season with a happy Bryant, who will be preparing to play in all 16 games."
How would you grade Dez Bryant's performance so far?
